1.0 out of 5 stars
Glue failed at the 5 year mark

I reattached the magnets with some epoxy, so they are good as new, but if someone is not as handy, they would be in the trash now.Is it too much to ask for very gently handles headphones to last for more than 5 years even if they are cheap? I don't think so.

title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
Big Sound, Short Comfort Window
text: The Sony WH-CH520 Wireless Headphones deliver impressively clear sound and marathon battery life at a budget-friendly price. Lightweight and stylish, they‚Äôre a solid pick for casual listening. However, Bluetooth can be temperamental, slow to pair and occasionally prone to dropouts. Comfort is another trade-off: the on-ear design feels tight over time, especially for kids, making long listening sessions less than ideal.Basically, they sound great and last forever but for all-day wear or seamless connectivity, they fall a bit short.
author: Sunny R

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Long lasting headphones with amazing battery life and sound.
text: Had these headphones for 5-6 years until I had accidentally sat on them, causing one of the muffs to snap off. And even then, the headphones still worked! I just had to buy another pair because I couldn‚Äôt glue the muff back to the headband. But honestly, these headphones are so durable. They‚Äôre a steal given its amazing quality.Durability: You don‚Äôt need to store them in any headphones case. You can put it in your purse, backpack, or bag leave them lying anywhere without worrying about them breaking. Coming from someone who uses these headphones all the time and as a to go for my workouts, and even wearing them on rainy days. Exposure to sweat and moisture in general never affected its sound quality at all! They‚Äôre super comfortable and light to wear and I find them so much better than $100-$300+ headphones.Comfort/Battery life: You can wear them for hours comfortably. I only needed to charge them once or twice every two weeks, and I use them for 4-5 hours daily. You only need to charge them for like 15-20 minutes and you‚Äôre good to go. They last FOREVER.Design: I love that they‚Äôre light weight and simple, making them really comfortable to wear. Personal preference but prefer lighter/simple headphones designs than chunky headphones.Sound: Even though they‚Äôre not noise cancelling they pack powerful sound and pretty good bass. You can listen on full volume without worrying about damaging them.Had to write a review bc these headphones are a gem. You should absolutely buy these if you‚Äôre looking for high quality and long lasting headphones on a tight budget.

I have a large head and these fit snug, but you can bend the plastic headband a bit and that works to get comfortable. The cord length is short, but good for a phone or sitting close to a laptop. It is a bit difficult to see which headphone is Left and Right, but there is an L and R if you look really closely. Be aware, there is no mic or volume button controls.

They are small and lightweight but fit my big head comfortably enough.Get these for a cheap portable set to use with your phone, or maybe a laptop. text: Still great sound quality after probably a year at this point of continuous use(besides charging and off time). Unlike other brands of headphones the ear cushions are still fine. The headband cushion on the other hand isn't. I've had to tape it up because the cushion cover was peeling away from the cushion. Probably means it's time to replace the cushion, but I'm not an expert on how to replace headphone cushions of any kind so...small duck tape roll it is until the sound or connectivity goes. Love the way it folds for travel, means I can fit it in my purse well. Also appreciate the L and R on the inside of the ear cushions area. Much more visible than other brands that have it above the ear cushions on the inside band of the headphones. Overall I would recommend these headphones.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Good bass response, excellent volume.  USB-C connection required.
text: These headphones sound pretty good.  The bass is nice, and while they don't have active noise-canceling, they do a good job of insulating your ear from outside noise.  The volume is excellent; I don't listen anywhere close to full volume as that gets pretty loud.  Note that these headphones have a USB-C connection; they don't use older 3.5mm or quarter-inch headphone jacks so make sure your source device supports USB-C headphones.  I used an adapter to plug these headphones into a USB-A port, and while it worked for the most part, I don't think the connection was quite stable enough to use on a regular basis and I wouldn't recommend going that route.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great Sound and Comfort for Everyday Use
text: These headphones are a solid choice if you're looking for reliable, wired, on-ear headphones with modern features. Earbuds tend to hurt my ears after wearing them for a while, so these headphones are a great alternative. The sound quality is impressive for the price. The USB-C connection is super convenient, especially for newer devices that don't have a headphone jack. I also appreciate the built-in 3-button remote and mic‚Äîit makes it easy to take calls or adjust the volume without reaching for my phone. The EQ presets are a nice bonus for tweaking the sound to your liking.Overall, a great value for everyday listening, work calls, or travel.

author: FFB

title:
2.0 out of 5 stars
Another example of a company ruining a product with absurd automatic functions
text: I bought these to replace a pair of BT510 that broke in my carry-on during a flight a few weeks ago. These were in sale, so figured I'd try the better model. I can't stand them. I think they sound a little worse than the cheaper 210s, but this is another product completely ruined by trying to decide for you what you want to do, and doing it, whether it's okay with you or not. They have some absurd feature where they automatically send a mute / pause command to any connected device if you so much as slightly light one side off your ear. Well first off that's just annoying in the first place, but even if I was into that kind of thing, they're so over-sensitive, that I've been using them for about a full week now, and not a single day has gone by that they havent shut off my music from me taking a sip of a drink, talking, or even just sitting absolutely still. SO frustrating. I'm going to buy another set of 210s because no way these are working on a flight with my head touching a headrest. To make matters worse, the first time I paired them to my phone, the driver asked permissions to link to my Google account?!?!? WHY?!?! I said no, and it did it anyway. Ita none of Googles business what headphones I'm wearing, and my email address and phone info darn sure isnt any of JBLs business. Only giving them 2 stars because the sound quality is half way decent when they dont stop your music. Oh, and the icing on the cake is the mute button functions as a hang up button on Teams, so yah, these hung up on a work conference call because I moved my mouth, and they sensed movement on my head and decided that means I want to hang up. Don't recommend these for any use, because they do what they want, and providing bare minimum basic function a set of speakers attached to your ears, is not one of those things! They're also extremely uncomfortable on my head compared to the 510s that are less than half the price.

They even act as hearing aids so I can eavesdrop on nearby conversations.Aside from all that, they connect seamlessly, they're comfortable enough to wear for hours, and the battery lasts for weeks. Can't recommend these enough
